website_summaries.verdict: Google's Nexus 7 continues to set the bar for small-screen tablets with a perfect balance between price and performance.
cons: Some third-party apps must be updated for Android 4.3

customer_reviews.title: Probably the Best Android Tablet Ever!
customer_reviews.text: The Nexus 7 built by ASUS might be getting on a bit now but it is a faultless Android tablet. In my opinion nothing has come close to beating it especially at the price. It still gets full Android support with the latest Android versions and security patches sent as regular updates. If you want a good, reliable Android tablet then you really can't beat this. The price is a true bargain and you don't get many of those these day. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: CoolUnc

customer_reviews.title: No card slot. So I curse this indestructible workhorse.
customer_reviews.text: I curse this every day as it doesn't have a card slot: should have noticed (no usb extension works , I've tried the lot). Also a lot of the limited memory is taken up with obligatory Google Aps that I don't want and don't use. Getting a really suitable case is an insoluble problem owing to the bad arrangment of outer slots, mike and camera. But in other respects it's light, robust, has an excellent screen. I pray every day it will conk out or break when I drop it so I can justify replacing it, but it refuses to die, despite careless treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Wotsut

customer_reviews.title: ) I really want to give it 5 stars as this is such a good device, just let down by the hardware
customer_reviews.text: As a tablet, it performs excellently. It's quick, responsive, lightweight and elegant. Unfortunately it's let down by its reliability. In less than 2 years I've had to replace the charging port twice as it kept breaking and refusing to charge. It also developed a sensor error where it wouldn't change from portrait to landscape or vice versa (this is a common fault with gen 2 Nexus' - Google it...) I really want to give it 5 stars as this is such a good device, just let down by the hardware. I'd buy another if they were cheaper and pretty much treat them as disposable as the cheaper Asus/Fire tablets are, but it's just too expensive to have poor hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Waldo P Barnstormer

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a replacement for my stolen Nexus 7, shame its not yet been updated to Lollipop but that will come in time. With the vast amount of apps available and a fair sized memory this tablet does everything I want it to do and more. The version I was supplied came with a European plug but the vendor apologised and said they would send the appropriate plug to me in the post. With just browsing or reading you'll get about 6-8 hours of life out of this device, with games that can come down to 3-4 dependent on the game. Overall a great tablet that I can take anywhere with me and hold in one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Winter

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet, huge improvement both physically & technically over the 2012 model.
customer_reviews.text: Great Nexus tablet with much better GPU than the sub-par Tegra on the previous version. Everything runs smoothly and quickly. Fantastic screen! Nice and light, easy to hold. The only issues are regular Android issues - mostly battery life & battery drain even when in airplane mode. However there are many things that can be disabled to improve this, like turning off background location/GPS services, auto-brightness, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet as I was in need of a new one and had just switched from the ipad 2 (which broke on me unfortunately) anyhow i wanted something a bit more budget and i saw many good reviews about this! its worked a treat, from when i first got it to now iv had no problems! I would rank it in my top 3! Pros The display is brilliant!! The design is slick!! Performance is very good!! Cons Cameras are poor (not suitable for the selfie lovers) No available SD slot to up your memory which does mean you may have to hold back and downloading too many large files
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Even my wife can work this
customer_reviews.text: I like to complain whenever I can but unfortunately I can't about the Nexus 7 except to ask why is the screen not non reflective? But then every screen is glossy. That aside, this knock the socks off any other tablet I have seen or owned. It certainly beats Mac products both in price and performance. Its so good the wife can work it and she has difficulty with the TV remote.
customer_reviews.author: Pete in Shropshire

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Had original Mk1 Nexus but it was getting slow. This later version with 2GB ram runs just fine. Does everything I want from a tablet, browse web download the odd file. Not the easiest thing to stream video to a TV and requires an app (free and available) to add additional USB memory, but a great screen and for the price unbeatable in my opinion. Would have given it 5 star if adding additional memory and streaming video was simpler.
customer_reviews.author: choc

customer_reviews.title: The closest was the Nvidia Shield which has superior graphics if not display but this was at the ...
customer_reviews.text: My last tablet was a nexus 7, a refurb that literally blinked out of life one night as I was reading. The USB port had become loose and the touchscreen suffered pangs of unresponsiveness on occasion. Those faults developed towards the end. Yet when I went to research a new tablet to replace what I thought would surely be a dated and obsolete piece of tech I could find no other in the price range that sported the same high quality display with such a long battery life. The closest was the Nvidia Shield which has superior graphics if not display but this was at the cost of battery life. Love the Nexus7.
customer_reviews.author: Peter O Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for the money
customer_reviews.text: I chose this tablet for the official updates from google straight away when they're released and the vanilla software. I got this from Amazon Warehouse deals for £145 I think, but it did come with a european plug and a UK adaptor. No big deal. I've had the tablet quite a few months now and like it a lot I have an iPhone 5 and the mix of 2 operating systems is a great balance. No problems with it what-so ever touch wood. The screen is nice and bright and everything looks super sharp. The battery life when I read books on it lasts about 8 hours with the screen near maximum brightness. Hope this review helps someone!
customer_reviews.author: Rcoops

customer_reviews.title: Delighted!
customer_reviews.text: Had the previous Nexus 7 which was good but this is so much better. The new slimline version makes it easier to hold in your hand. Sound is vastly superior to previous Nexus 7. Clear screen. Having read many reviews of current market tablets, I decided to hunt down a 2013 Nexus 7 and am delighted that I did.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: A worthy upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a direct replacement for the original Nexus 7, which finally died after 4 years. The improvements are definitely worthwhile. I would agree with the point made by an earlier review - get an induction charger for the device. It makes recharging so much simpler, and doesn't stress the USB socket. One point to note, because this is a Google device, it receives updates regularly, and this did take a while when I first booted up, but it is now running Marshmallow quite happily.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm Jones

customer_reviews.title: amazing product. fast and powerful
customer_reviews.text: amazing product. fast and powerful, however, there are a few major faults with the device in general, number 1, the device has problems with screen, the screen often becomes unresponsive at times and wont work at all, i found that having a a sleep and wake case may cause this, 2nd, the device also sometimes stops auto rotating and the sensors become futile. this can be fixed with your own fix by checking you tube etc. other than this its the best budget tablet out on the market, and you cant go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: yaser

customer_reviews.title: Go and get one
customer_reviews.text: If I could surgical release my son from his new nexus to have a look at it, I could write a better review - but suffice to say, it must be good as it's not been out of his hands since Christmas Day! Took about half hour to do all the upgrades when first switched on, but all good. Go and get one. My son wanted a Samsung, but after research I got this and he's more than happy.
customer_reviews.author: S Vanstone

customer_reviews.title: Nexus 7 Tablet 2nd edition 32 gb
customer_reviews.text: It arrived quickly and safely, as usual , well packed and at a good price . It is superb and I am very pleased with it's capabilities I will never use all of them. A very good clear screen. To test it, I have down loaded 7 films and only half the memory has been used. I have bought a Google Chromecast to cast to the tv as you can't use a wired connection from the slimport . I think they should fix that to make it unbeatable. One other quibble is that there is no slot for an sd card. It would be nice but with 32 gig I don't really need to worry. Otherwise, a constant companion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just as reviewers have said
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a year old tablet that was staggering under the amount of use I wanted to give it. The Android upgrade together with the admittedly expensive bigger memories, means this one is like greased lightening compared with my previous tablets. I can see using it instead of my desktop computer. Screen shots with the on/off and volume switches simultaneously are tricky as they are angled towards the rear on the bevel edge. I am awaiting some adapters to see if I can increase its use with the use of memory sticks. I am uncertain about having to have a Google account to get the best out of it as I am with all 'cloud storage'.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: This can't possible have been new I had bought one two or three years before I was so pleased I bought another one
customer_reviews.text: I will be sending back , one year and two weeks it is not working? This can't possible have been new I had bought one two or three years before I was so pleased I bought another one . So I hope someone will put this right , I'm so disappointment . June
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of the first generation Nexus 7 and although it's still working it's very slow compared to this one. The new slim line version is easier to hold and the screen resolution is exceptional. An excellent delivery service to here to Spain. My only disappointment is on arrival there was no power at all in the battery and once charged I spent sometime updating the operating system. This suggests it may have been in stock for a while. Having said that once up to date I am now very pleased with the product and its performance and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Challinor

customer_reviews.title: A great choice
customer_reviews.text: These are just such great value for what you get. The smaller format means the screens aren't massive. Think of them as really big phones. Browsing the web, reading a book, watching a video all perfectly adequate. Yes, it would be better on a larger screen but the screen quality is excellent and it is very portable - you can slip them in a pocket. The processor is still performing well and they look and feel like a quality product. The android OS allows you to create restricted user profiles for kids. Simpy a great product.
customer_reviews.author: NeilG

customer_reviews.title: This has been a good buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Huddl 1. It's been great. Good memory, fast, good sound and image quality. I use it for watching downloaded programs, listening to music, reading books and magazine and documents, editing documents, internet searches (not as good as my laptop for this though), and emails. The camera is ok for snaps but not high quality. It's small and light enough to carry in my handbag everyday so gets lots of use unlike a bigger heavier netbook. At just over £100 it's been good value.
customer_reviews.author: Met L.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing in the long run
customer_reviews.text: This was a gorgeous, speedy, easy to use tablet. Now it's a plastic brick that takes hours to charge (but only via the induction, no charge holds through standard USB port) but doesn't hold it for long. Really disappointing. Thousands of users have reported these issues. It should have lasted much longer. Was not sold as a disposable device. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Bentley

customer_reviews.title: It has a nice screen, it is quick and it is also ...
customer_reviews.text: Very surprised by this device. It has a nice screen, it is quick and it is also very light. Not the thinnest thing in the World, however, it fits nicely in the palm of my hand. All the apps work well and I really enjoyed using it for Amazon Prime. I seriously cannot recommend this device highly enough .You are getting something fairly powerful that does everything well and for that alone, you will be satisfied, however, when you take into considering how cheap it is, it makes you love it even more. Just buy it and be happy!
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Wolfram

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet in its price bracket - 2 years later still going strong
customer_reviews.text: Great Tablet. For me the best of it price class. It has all the features that I required, and has outdone competitors in the higher price brackets. I really can not speak highly enough about this Tablet, and would recommend it to anyone that does not want to fork out for anything in the 400 GBP brackets. 2 and a hlaf years on, and this thing is still working perfectly. I have traveled the world with it and dropped it all over, and it still has a perfect screen and runs everything I have put on it. Battery has stood up well too.
customer_reviews.author: Hannicka

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant for it's price
customer_reviews.text: Considering this tablet I bought this tablet for only £141 I consider it value for money. It does everything a table is supposed to do like watching movies and tv programmes and surfing the web, it's also works well with streaming too. If you want a tablet and don't want to use it for anything extravagant I has nothing bad to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: 3agle 3yes

customer_reviews.title: Suddenly closes down
customer_reviews.text: I won't be writing a long review about my Nexus albeit to echo others to say it is ideal. Great slim light size for holding in one hand. I was however on the verge of sending it back because it started to randomly to put itself to sleep. I am pleased to report it wasn't the Nexus itself it was the case I had bought for it.The magnet in the cover that puts it to sleep when closed was also doing it when I was using it and had the cover folded right back. So Long as I do not let the cover touch the back there is not a problem now.
customer_reviews.author: bons

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet by far
customer_reviews.text: Best tablet by far, superb picture, excellent battery life. Sound a little weak but I bough a blue tooth speaker and it's fine. Just found out as well that it wirelessly connects to my Sony Bravia TV. I got a VicTsing 32GB Android Smart Phone USB Flash Drive Disk Micro USB2.0 and a MOFRED®-Micro USB Host Mode On The Go OTG Cable for Nexus 7 to increase the storage (you need to download the Nexus Media Share app from Playstore, cheap). Even with a one bar Wi-Fi signal it plays SKY GO, BBC I-Player etc easily. Buy it, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: macdive

customer_reviews.title: Superb product
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for an alternative to an Ipad mini and don't want to pay Apple prices or aren't fully hooked into the Apple eco-system, then this tablet is ideal. There are cheaper alternatives now with Android, but for me, I wanted to ensure I had the latest and cleanest Android experience in the best hardware and this provides both. The size is just right for my purpose, the screen is stunning and the audio quality is good too (which surprised me as I'd heard bad things about the speakers). I'm now an Android convert - my phone is now a Nexus 5 too following the experience I had with this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: M. Webster

customer_reviews.title: Been a long-time Apple fan, now also an Android fan
customer_reviews.text: I've always owned Apple devices (including an iPad), but decided to try out an Android device since I'm currently developing Android apps as part of my degree. I'm delightfully surprised by this device - the screen is very sharp, the OS (running latest version: Marshmallow) is beautiful and very easy to use, and using/switching between apps is very fluid/snappy. The tablet is also very nice to hold and use. Despite owning a 9.7-inch iPad, I've not found the 7-inch screen to be too small (in fact I actually really quite like this size). Thoroughly pleased with this purchase, especially for the price. Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: JamieG

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Brain.
customer_reviews.text: I snorted at these gadgets when they first appeared. 'It's not a phone, but it's also not as functional as a Laptop, so what's the point?' How wrong I was. Since getting this excellent little device I carry it with me everywhere. It's like my 2nd brain. Take note, this may not be as big as some of the Ipads or other tablets you've seen you friends using. This may or not appeal to you. Personally I like the smaller size as it will clutter up your brief case/purse less. It also fits nicely on the inside of my favor winter coat.
customer_reviews.author: Romparose

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet - even has backup methods of charging
customer_reviews.text: 2 years on, I still use this and it is great. Still supported on android and can do anything I'd expect from a tablet. Charge is not bad and might require a full recharge every 2 days - depends on usage really. Talking of charging, my charging port on the bottom broke after a few too may drops while charging, leaving me unable to connect with a USB cable - this is my own fault. Luckily for me, I can wirelessly charge this tablet and has proven to be a solid method of doing so for over a year now. I broken it through my own fault but had a backup for such a serious problem, truly wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Gates

customer_reviews.title: ... a Xmas present a few years ago and it's amazing. Still as smooth and fast as the day ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my mum as a Xmas present a few years ago and it's amazing. Still as smooth and fast as the day I bought it and it gets updates fast meanwhile my same age xperia which has a lot better hardware is showing its age. This tablet is as smooth as my s6 edge. Battery lasts forever with android marshmallow. Next phone may be a nexus as they seem great and last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Nexus 7 tablet
customer_reviews.text: I have used a windows tablet and can honestly say I prefer this Android Nexus. Very easy to set up. I purchased it to store movies for a long haul flight. I am happy with the picture quality.Haven't any complaints about it. Definitely good value for the price in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Vancruffy

customer_reviews.title: clear images and the goggle voice command is the best I've tried
customer_reviews.text: There are such a lot of tablets to choose from it's a nightmare. It's user friendly, clear images and the goggle voice command is the best I've tried, a lot of tablets don't pick up on the accurate wording but this one is brilliant. I would certainly recommend the Nexus every time
customer_reviews.author: kay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic tablet, exactly as I had expected. I own a Nexus 4 so this is the perfect partner for that. Watching TV via the BBC iplayer or 4OD puts my HD television to shame, the picture quality is superb. I watch a lot more catch-up TV now that I have this to enjoy it on. The Kindle app makes my Kindle (keyboard version) look crap, Now I use the Nexus 7 all the time instead. I must admit that when it first arrived it had a habit of stuttering occasionally, but once Android 4.4 was installed those strange stutters disappeared.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good functionality but overpriced as not built to last
customer_reviews.text: Loved this when I first got it, functionality was fantastic and used it all the time but very disappointed that just after a year of ownership (and therefore out of warranty) it decided charging would be very hit and miss and gradually got worse to the point where it would not charge at all. Google did make lots of suggestions about trying different chargers and software fixes etc but it is actually the physical port on the device which is the problem. So I won't be buying another one if it ASUS branded. If something is not going to last you may as well go for a cheaper option!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: The 10" nexus is great but if you want to take it everywhere with ...
customer_reviews.text: Having used my old nexus for some time I bought the new update and have now used it daily for some weeks ,I cannot fault it and would not be without it .The new nexus is a slim version of the old but faster and very reliable, I now rarely use my PC and the size means that it will fit in my coat pocket and go anywhere. The 10" nexus is great but if you want to take it everywhere with you you may as well buy a laptop.I think the nexus 7 7-inch is the best on the market
customer_reviews.author: Torchy

customer_reviews.title: Basically a big phone without a Sim Card
customer_reviews.text: Needed a tablet to use in lectures and on my backpacking trip. Don't like apple and their extortionate prices and like android software. This was £100 cheaper than the Samsung galaxy tab so went for it. Runs on KitKat 4.4 and is basically an android phone with an enlarged screen, without the simcard to call and text. for me it was ideal as it meant when I bought a case with a keyboard it became a small net-book, used it for browsing and the hostel-world app was easier to use on a bigger device. Didn't play many games on it but the office app helps in lectures and very easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Sumaria

customer_reviews.title: Much cleverer than I am - I think I need to buy a book about it!
customer_reviews.text: Splendid. Using it for Sky Demon in a microlight, but the GPS chip is really good and even works in buses and trains. For some reason it occasionally decides to Close the app without me telling it to, but in the main, very good. Power switch is a bit fiddly and tricky to find when used in a Mofred sleeve. Haven't figured out how to interface it to my network of Windows PCs yet - I'm sure there must be a way. Remarkable the way it captures photos I post to Picasa from my PC
customer_reviews.author: nereus senex

customer_reviews.title: Our 3rd, through no fault of the product. ...
customer_reviews.text: Our 3rd,through no fault of the product. Our two year old mastered turning it on, loading Netflix and streaming cartoons with no input or encouragement from us. He's had a few accidents, and replacing the unit has proved cheaper than multiple new screens. When you get a new one, it automatically loads your software from previous versions. Can't wait for the next version, so the 7s can be cheaper when he breaks the next one.
customer_reviews.author: Loren Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this direct from Amazon, for my elderly mother, but when it was delivered it had: a) A plug that did not fit a UK 3-pin socket (the earth pin was too small and short) b) Spanish language setting. I will now contact Amazon to see if they will send a replacement plug and cable. Update 25 Jan 2014 - very helpful response from Amazon (thank you online-help staff). Seems that the plug is okay, and only had a "fold down" earth pin. Now working fine. My mother loves this Nexus tablet.
customer_reviews.author: SJHEARN

customer_reviews.title: Superb bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: I had the previous version first and this is so much better - better memory management, much faster, wonderful definition, very responsive screen. Owing to my having a tremor I use TouchPal keyboard app and a microfibre stylus for input. True the device has no vibrate, Flash support or LED flash - but it can be charged on a Qi wireless charger so does not have the problem of plugging and unplugging breaking the socket. Great Wi-Fi, GPS, Bluetooth, great for games, all in all worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Roe

customer_reviews.title: My tablet = my happy time! 😊
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love my tablet! Have had it for just over a year and is still like new. One thing I will say, which doesn't make it a bad tablet, some of my friends have told me it has happened to their tablets as well but all have different makes. The charger lead only lasted about 4 months and since then I have had to replace it and have bought and used 2 other cables. Apart from that all very good and would really recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Great for starters, but the competition is too high.
customer_reviews.text: Had this little guy for about 6 months before the screen died and I was offered a repair for more than the original cost of the tablet (don't ask me how that works...). Overall, a beautiful product to use with exceptional performance and quality, but not without its flaws. I've since moved to the iPad Air, and don't regret spending the extra pennies. This is a great starting point for tablet users, but you'll want to move up in due time.
customer_reviews.author: RGKnott

customer_reviews.title: Nicely sized device which is both small enough to be portable and large enough for constant use.
customer_reviews.text: A quality product which delivers in all the key areas. Very fast, plenty of Ram, excellent screen, great camera and features. You could throw your money away and get an inferior ipad mini I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Mcmorrow

customer_reviews.title: Great little tablet.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of one of these. It does exactly what I want it to do! That is check my e-mails, read the daily paper on it, play a few games on it, look at some photos, Facebook, watch the odd movie from Netflix, watch Sky TV. It does all of that with no effort whatsoever. It is fast and reliable with a good battery life (depending on what your doing on it obviously). Would recommend this without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Jimbijimbob

customer_reviews.title: Google Nexus 7 Tablet 32 GB
customer_reviews.text: I can't recommend this too highly. I got it for my wife who prefers not to use a PC (either laptop or desktop) and she is now using the tablet for email and for reading books (Google Play Store is a rich source of books, both free and paid for). The Android apps available for her to use mean that she now uses the tablet regularly ..... and I can turn her old desktop into a backup NAS!!
customer_reviews.author: John Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: this is a great Tablet. works fine, fast. wifi is good. i would have got the Nexus 10 (2). but its not out and it would cost about 200 extra, so thats why i got this one. It even works with the new software "KitKat" updated automatically. i can even play Battlefield 4 Commander mode on it. which is good for when your away from home. I just have to figure out the adapters that you can buy to hoop up a sd card with usb cable. 64GB or 128GB would have been nice. maybe next time.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good for general browsing and browser games
customer_reviews.text: Great device for general browsing, bigger screen than a normal smartphone but easier to handle than a full size tablet. Battery life is good, runs a full day comfortably at normal use; more convenient than switching the laptop on and off all the time and uses less energy than keeping the laptop on. Camera is okay, but the primary function is for picking up and browsing on a reasonably sized screen.
customer_reviews.author: Hadouken

customer_reviews.title: Very good and I would say far better than the iPad for the money
customer_reviews.text: This works really well and both the graphics and the touch screen are very responsive and does not suffer from any jitter even when playing games. Tons of storage for anything you want to store. Even a friend who is an avid Apple fan was impressed with this device. The only real issue I have is that if you want to play a Facebook game it will not sync with your progress from a PC. The only other issue is the same as on the iPad, you cant view Flash Player content such as a video on the BBC News website.
customer_reviews.author: C. Weston

customer_reviews.title: great device great price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tablet for my family and my self :). I have the nexus 4 phone so very easy to use and always up to date with Google's SW. What I love about the nexus 7 is there is no contract and for £208 it's a steal! I'm my eyes this is better than the iPad. As we all share the nexus 7 we have our own space/account which you can switch very easily and that way we can download our own apps access to our emails change modify your widgets and so on. I love the android firmware if your looking for a tablet get the Nexus7
customer_reviews.author: Marty Is God

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet shame about the build quality
customer_reviews.text: This product was great for the price and the best on the market at the time, the 7" tablet just fits in my jacket pocket, which is superb for walking the hills and footpaths. However this is the second Nexus 7 tablet I have purchased and failed, with what seems to be a hardware fault, after 15months and my previous Nexus 7 did exactly the same, so not happy at all with build quality.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if it meets your needs, excellent for me with the best value/price ratio.
customer_reviews.text: I knew when buying that this product has no memory expansion slot, and the battery can't be replaced neither. It was the best regarding performance versus price. I'm very satisfied with it. My previous experience is based on galaxy tab 2 10" Wifi. Amazon wrote me an eMail to rate the dealer (was perfect) but when following the lead I landed here to rate the product!
customer_reviews.author: Herbert R

customer_reviews.title: great product, ease of use, great screen, latest android lollipop
customer_reviews.text: Great product, downloaded to 5.1.1 and still works really well even with full of apps. Smooth transition between screens with great clear sound. The screen is very clear but surprisingly not as bright as my hudl 2. Maybe because got it on automatic brightness. The quality of the build is rigid and well built. This came with KitKat 4.4.2 and manufactured in Nov 2014 so the build is less than a year old.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Hardwick

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Google Nexus 7 7-inch Tablet (2GB RAM,
customer_reviews.text: Would be better with a slightly protruding on/off button a la the Sony Xperia tablets, because I'm forever groping for that on this one, but other than that, this is very competent product - impressively bright and clear screen yet still small enough (just) to use as a car satnav (with a decent holder that is - see my reviews of the best I've found here on Amazon).
customer_reviews.author: James Towers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful Tablet better than any other my daughter has bought previously! Customer Service 2nd to none!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nutan Gupta /Anil Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: There were a few apps that we desperately wanted from google. this was bought after a lot of consideration and research. We love it. It is so easy to use and does everything we hoped it would. Seriously impressed with how good this is.
customer_reviews.author: Cartwheeling Dragons

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet from Asus
customer_reviews.text: These are great little tablets, we use them for our camera gimbals so that others can view what the operator is viewing for directing and such. Nice clear screen and intuitive to use. We have also used Asus laptops and netbooks which have been very well made and long lasting. Would recommend the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong (purchased 2014)
customer_reviews.text: Still using this excellent tablet. Probably one of the few tablets running Android Marshmallow with its timely security updates etc. Still probably the only tablet with wireless charging. Excellent screen. Only four stars because no expandable storage (typical Nexus/Google) and boot up time is a good 45 seconds (always has been, it's not getting worse)
customer_reviews.author: cherokee40

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed that I may have bought the American version
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my son as a present. He just telephoned me to say it had arrived with an American charger (so I have now ordered him another charger!), and no instructions, so I have a nasty feeling this isn't the UK version. I had read one of the reviews saying to be careful about the American version being sold by Quality Bargains so I thought I had been careful and researched and read all the reviews. Think Amazon should take more responsibility for goods that are sold 'fulfilled but Amazon'! , to ensure customers are aware of what exactly they are buying.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Super tablet, bought for a single purpose but also takes great promotional photos. A favourite with our staff and I regret not buying a few when available.
customer_reviews.author: Bean15

customer_reviews.title: Needless to say this is a million times better. The google play store is far superior to ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as I had a kindle fire HD before which constantly froze. Needless to say this is a million times better. The google play store is far superior to the Amazon App Store. The YouTube app works far better (no freezing mid way through and fast loading). In general the whole tablet is quick to load. The screen is gorgeous, really vivid nice colours and the design of the tablet itself is simple but nice to look at. Didn't take me long to work out the interface either.
customer_reviews.author: SpaceChannel5

customer_reviews.title: ... 5mm long scratch at the bottom which also cuts pretty deep, you actually feel it with your finger ...
customer_reviews.text: the screen got one less than 5mm long scratch at the bottom which also cuts pretty deep, you actually feel it with your finger tip, but other than that, the tablet looks brand new, considering this is a refurbished unit and price point (got mine at GBP115) I would say it is a good buy. the hardware is still decent even in 2015, as the cpu is actually a underlocked S600 and equipped with 2GB of RAM. There is a further improvement in animation fluency and increase in rendering speed of pdf file or webpages when I upgraded mine to Android 5.0 I suspect the Nexus 7 can live though 2015 and doesn't feel terribly obsolete.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Packed with features without busting your wallet
customer_reviews.text: A great little tablet for less than £200? I was super sceptical coming from an iPad having cost twice as much, but once I started using it I wasn't disappointed. The screen is crisp and clear boasting a lovely 1920x1080 resolution, much better than the iPad Mini (Non Retina) The whole thing feels snappy and works brilliantly with Android 4.4.3 (Now available via software update). Perfect for surfing the web, checking up on Facebook or watching Netflix!
customer_reviews.author: theMojoWill

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a while
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed after a while it stopped working Google log permanent on and it doesn’t reset or anything But it was great while it worked
customer_reviews.author: Marli

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant piece of kit!
customer_reviews.text: A fabulous piece of kit - great size for travelling in some of the smallest of bags (ladies, we'll be fine!), and without any of the additional rubbish that tablets created by brands like Samsung add in, meaning the actual gigabit size you get is very close to what is advertised! Media, music and reading is all very comfortably done, and works flawlessly. I am very, very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Vittorie

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet after a disappointing experience with the Tesco Hudl where the screen froze. I have found it fantastic and very easy to use. Setting it up was a synch. Just make sure you charge it before the battery is completely dead as it doesn't really like it. You can easily get it going again but it's a bit fiddly as you have to press the volume and power button and hold them down.
customer_reviews.author: AliceG

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet for reading books. Very good battery life.
customer_reviews.text: The best features to price ratio for a tablet at this moment. Excellent for reading books, it's width is small enough to be held with one hand. Battery lasts for almost a week if you keep the WiFi off when you don't need it and you don't play games.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandru Balmus

customer_reviews.title: Superb Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for a couple of months now and it has proven to be an indispensable device. The battery life is very good. The screen is superb. It is relatively light and easy to hold. As it is QI enabled, you can use wireless charging (even when it is inside a case), and that will save wear and tear of the micro-usb socket. As it is a Google device, the OS is updated automatically.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. K

customer_reviews.title: A Superb Small Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this product despite having to pay nearly £140. Not a mark on it and its 32 GB memory gives me a lot of leeway for storage. I now use it more frequently than my Kindle Fire HD, which is more used as a reader as it has a more convenient less elongated format. The Asus is ideal for films and also noticeably lighter and sharper than my 1st generation Kindle Fire HD
customer_reviews.author: tony whewell

customer_reviews.title: Expected Gen2 (2gbram, 1920x1200 screen, 1. 5ghz ...
customer_reviews.text: Expected Gen2 (2gbram, 1920x1200 screen, 1.5ghz processor) What arrived (1gbram, 800x1260 screen, 1.2ghz processor) I was sold a gen 2 tablet and received a gen 1. Not impressed. Now chasing refund.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Rentes

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Nexus 7 2013. I bought 2 when they first came out, which are still going strong. I needed another for my dad, and after researching i found the Nexus 7 still has better specs than the newer budget tablets. At this price too, it's a steal. Ahead of it's time, i think :)
customer_reviews.author: MiTz

customer_reviews.title: Good all round Tablet very impressed !!
customer_reviews.text: Prompt delivery tablet arrived in a safe and secure packaging , set-up guide was clear and easy to read and understand , set-up of tablet was very quick and easy screen resolution was very impressive, sound is crystal clear with fair mixture of bass and tone, navigation is consistent and very responsive downloading and uploading is very quick and effective picture quality is clear, detailed, sharp, Product is fairly priced and has many extra features web browsing is very slick and fast. would recommend this product to anyone looking for a clear,slick,effective, solid, consistent, fairly priced 7'' tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Mohamad Bheekhun

customer_reviews.title: Great small sized tablet
customer_reviews.text: The screen is amazingly sharp and very bright even on medium brightness setting it is very clear. And it is an extremely fast device compared to my very old single core android phone, large apps some over 100mb download in mere seconds and we pages load instantly, multitasking is very fluid with apps changing instantly with only an attractive transition animation in-between. The stock android experience is clean and simple although you may get less bells and whistles than other modified versions of android and I have noticed some really nice keyboard features on the Samsung galaxy note 8. But I have experienced no lag which I hear some versions of android on less power can be troubled with
customer_reviews.author: MyAmazon

customer_reviews.title: I like it very much
customer_reviews.text: I like it very much, the battery charges from 0 to 100 in 10 hours, so I think that's ok. Screen resolution is great. Another great thing, unlike apple products, on this you can copy movies from your computer, just connect the usb cable and using My computer you can drag movies from your computer to the tablet. I would recommend it 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Bogdan

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tablet, both in terms of looks and quality. The back has a lovely feel, not dimpled like the 2013 version, and the tablet is also slimmer and lighter. The design has slightly rounded edges which look really nice. The screen is super responsive and is full HD so pictures look amazing on it. The OS (Android) is fast for everything I've tried it with so far. Would recommend to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Hi res!
customer_reviews.text: Does what it should well. Low use battery is good, several days sat about with occasional use. But as other tablets, play a game and battery goes fast (Smallworld 2). Also, lot's of games are optimised for lower resolutions, which means they are tiny on this screen, although I guess time will solve that. Also maybe there's a setting for lower res somewhere I haven't found. Biggest drawback is lack of instructions - I know it's fairly intuitive, but no manual at all. Maybe put an electronic one on front screen to read if you want?
customer_reviews.author: S. Waddington

customer_reviews.title: Great slate
customer_reviews.text: Only reason it doesn't get 5 is lack of card slot. Great display, fast streaming and minimal bloatware. Feels good in the hand. This mmodel may be a bit long in the tooth now but still up with the best. I purchased and returned 2 "competitor" mdeal before going to this one due to really poor performance. For the money this is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I am not very technical and this could not have been easier to start using. Very light and slim and so quick and clear to use. Love it and use it more than my other - which unfortunately was damaged in a car accident. I should say it was not driving but in the boot. Easy to set up and everything is there that I could possibly need to make my life easier. Fab product
customer_reviews.author: Ms. S. Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: It's not the fastest tablet out there but it's good value for money
customer_reviews.text: It's not the fastest tablet out there but it's good value for money. I was expecting more of a step up from the previous Nexus 7 but it's not. This is probably due to the Lollipop upgrade. I was having issues with over heating. When playing a heavy game, the tablet overheats after about 10 minutes and causes a warning to come on screen. Nexus cameras are not the best. The speakers are loud but standard quality.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good size, good price, good performance.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this before I had a smart phone and even now it's WAY easier to read, uses the same software and apps and is an invaluable tool when travelling or just "searching" when in bed. Impressed with the performance. Battery life WAY better than smartphones. Why a 4? Time will tell if it warrants a 5 but so far ...so good. Also of note is that it's HALF the price of a smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Brown

customer_reviews.title: great device
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice device. Had they old 2012 version but it is now slow as it cannot handle the upgrades. And Google do not seem able to fix them. So worried about buying the 2013. No problem, upgraded three times in a few hoursvand it is now singing along with Android 6.1. Like it lots.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Goolge has Done it , this is a great mini Tablet , you are getting lots for for the price, I think it's a great tablet
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my boyfriend & he was likening it a lot ,he took good care & one morning he tuned it on & t popped ,the screen had a crack affected . Amazon & Google were great about it & when my boyfriend retunes from France I'm going to try to talk him into getting another one , The only negative thing I could say is that the photo quality isn't very good
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Love It.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd tablet and everyone in the family loves this. We had a Galaxy Tab 2 10.1. And I was a bit apprehensive in going down in screen size. But wow am i glad. It runs everything so smoothly. No lag what so ever on anything. On the Tab everything began to lag after 1 month and got progressively worse. Games are fun. Typing is smoother and easier. Movies and comics looks exellent. Very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Steadily went downhill from day one. Whether it is the updates or the hardware being damaged the screen is perpetually snowy and then recovers only to become disrupted and jumpy. Can't get longer than half an hour's normal performance. It's marginally better after a total reset but ends up corrupted again over time. Sick of having to reload all my apps as I can't get a backup to work properly. I don't need this kind of rubbish in my life. I bought this as an alternative to the Apple monopoly but it looks like at least Apple have reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: This is my second Nexus and I love it, I now prefer it to my iPad ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Nexus and I love it, I now prefer it to my iPad mini, which I had nothing but trouble with one way or another and I had it less than a year. I love everything about it. The sound and the picture on it are both superior to the iPad mini I had, and so far I've had no trouble with it at all. I absolutely recommend this to anyone that is interested.
customer_reviews.author: Remote Control

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I have N7 1 and now the N72013 eddtion is just fantastic i saw all the reviews read all the comments but when you have thi devise in your had well. The screen hits you its clear sharp, and pops out. Sound much better and just smooth as slik. im very happy with mine. now i can babble on and on but you have to hold this thing and play with it then you will no what i mean Games on this and films are flat out amazing.
customer_reviews.author: YUBABA

customer_reviews.title: Google Nexus tablet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tablet on behalf of my brother and his family. They wanted a tablet to take on the plane for their two young boys. They downloaded some films and the quality was amazing. If your not into Apple then this is the next best thing. Great value for money being on average any where between £50-£80 cheaper than the IPad mini. They were all really please with it and found it very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: the price is a steal for what you get
customer_reviews.text: It took ages to arrive over 2 weeks but I've gotten over that! I Love it its lightening fast, great screen pretty good battery all the apps I want are available on it which is the main reason I got it as my kindle fire HD was a nightmare for getting even basic apps like YouTube or any TV streaming apps. The only problem I've had is if your watching a movie in an app like cartoon HD that's in widesceen it further pinches down the screen which is already physically a wide screen format so makes the view even smaller.
customer_reviews.author: conor mccarthy

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Tablet
customer_reviews.text: After some initial setup problems this has turned out to be a fantastic tablet. The mapping GPS function allowed me to find my way around new places while on holiday.I have not downloaded many Apps yet but those I have used have been very goood. I still have a lot to learn about it and purchased a Magazine dedicated to Nexus tablets to give me more information on it. The Manufacturer could improve the information supplied with the new tablet for people like me who are not too tech savvy.
customer_reviews.author: martin mc guinness

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this one
customer_reviews.text: Had to upgrade, as my original Nexus 7, became sluggish, due to system updates. Very pleased with this one, just hope google doesn't make a has of it with the updates again. Slimmer than the original, better sound and sharper screen. Hope it's still performing as well in 12 months
customer_reviews.author: David Morgan-williams

customer_reviews.title: Connection problems
customer_reviews.text: Have had problems getting it connected to our Broadband/Wi-Fi account - a Talk-Talk engineer is coming to sort it out--a little frustrating though as there were no instructions with the Tablet from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: DAVE REYNOLDS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tablet having had the opportunity to look at one in depth, as a couple of friends had one, and did some research online comparing it against other tablets of similar price. Found it very easy to use, an excellent display and sufficient memory for all the music and films I wanted to upload. Never having downloaded apps, I found this a very simple process and a vast array of various apps, both free and at cost.
customer_reviews.author: CDS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for money
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd nexus 7 in our house. My husband and I both have one but my husband's was an early one without the choice of front or rear camera. It was also playing up. Looked at buying a different tablet but nothing else compared for the price. Great shame they no longer produce them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great value tablet
customer_reviews.text: this is a kindle / ipad cross, fits in your back jeans pocket and you can play all your apps / games / email on it , yes its not as 'good' as an ipad - and being honest at home i still go for the ipad over this - BUT when goign out and about its perfect as its much smaller , only negative is the battery - even when 'turned of' the battery dies after a few weeks.. while the ipad pings back on were you left it - so remmeber to keep it charged!
customer_reviews.author: tomkbucks

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this to anyone looking to buy a 7 inch tablet for their home or for average office needs. It offers good speed and fast web browsing. I synced my gmail and microsoft exchange account pretty easily and it does the updating etc on its own. Viber, Skype, facebook and what's app all works well. My daughter has downloaded few games like subway surfer etc and they works well with out slowing the tablet. With an average office / home use the battery last up to 2 days easily. I think its a smart tablet and good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Raaz

customer_reviews.title: Serious problems with Iplayer
customer_reviews.text: There are serious technical problems with BBC Iplayer. I bought the tablet to download BBC programs then watch them offline. You can only do this for 10 minutes or so before the picture stutters and eventually stops. Its a known fault and so far there is no fix. Other than this problem its a super tablet but as that's all I use it for its almost useless for me
customer_reviews.author: mr jj baker

customer_reviews.title: Replacement
customer_reviews.text: This was bought to replace a nexus 7 which was old and no longer held the charge in the battery so it is as expected. New model slightly different in size. Very easy to import all apps and details from old tablet to new.
customer_reviews.author: egyptian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tablet
customer_reviews.text: Even being a three year old design, still a very capable tablet, I looked around at many others, but decided the Nexus was still the one to go for, took a while for it to update itself once powered up, but it's now running android lollipop, silky smooth
customer_reviews.author: NatchoNatchoMan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tablet
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a nexus 7 2012. Screen quality is excellent and the speakers are much louder so I can discard the external speaker that I had purchased. It takes a little longer to switch on which I suppose might indicate that it is slower, but I havnt noticed this for browsing and skype
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Nexus 7 2013
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice tablet. The battery life is substantial which means when you take it out and about you can rely on the battery lasting. I had a Samsung Galaxy 7" before but I much prefer this one as it seems to get me to apps quicker. The only odd thing is the plug, which was sent under separate cover, is for a Samsung and not a Asus Nexus 7 which is very bad policy. I know they both have same micro USB ports but even so, not good. Such a shame to lose a star rating over this
customer_reviews.author: KAREN STANBRIDGE

product_meta.title: ASUS Google Nexus 7 7-inch Tablet (2GB RAM, 32GB eMMC)
product_meta.description:
Size Name:32 GB| Colour Name:Black

NEXUS 7 7-INCH TABLET 
PORTABLE, POWERFUL AND MADE FOR WHAT MATTERS TO YOU
Nexus 7 -- the powerful, portable 7-inch tablet -- is from Google, made in collaboration with ASUS. Nexus 7 is powered by Android, so you can choose from more than 975,000 apps and games available, including thousands of tablet optimised titles. There really is something for everyone.

Keep your music, videos, photos and files secure by backing them up to the cloud. Featuring Cingo virtual surround sound and built-in wireless charging, there’s a lot to love in a surprisingly slim 7-inch tablet. You can game with friends, check your email, post an update and discover something new all with one tablet. 

AT A GLANCE
 *  7-inch 1920 x 1200 HD display (323ppi) 
 *  5 MP rear-facing camera 
 *  1.2 MP rear-facing camera 
 *  Up to 10 hours battery life between charges
 *  Android Jelly Bean 4.3 operating system 
 *  Choose from a 16GB or 32GB hard drive 
 *  Dual-band Wi-Fi, NFC and Bluetooth 4.0 connectivity 
 *  Built-in wireless charging 
 *  Scratch-resistant Corning glass 

SHARP 7-INCH TABLET SCREEN
Thin, light and fast, the Nexus 7 offers an ideal mix of power and portability, and features a very sharp screen, putting more than 2.3-million pixels in the palm of your hand. With 323 pixels packed into every inch, you can read text that’s sharper than the printed page, see images more vivid than high-quality photo magazines, and watch videos come to life in vibrant 1080p HD.

LIGHT AND LONG-LASTING
The clean, simple design of the Nexus 7 features a slim body, a thin bezel and a soft-touch, matte back. So it sits comfortably in the palm of your hand while the bright 7-inch HD display brings your entertainment to life. 

At just 290g (0.64Ibs), the Nexus 7 is light enough to take anywhere and fits easily in to bags, backpacks and back-pockets. With up to 9 hours of HD video playback and 10 hours of web browsing or e-reading between charges, there's plenty of juice to get you through the day, and built-in wireless charging means you can charge, grab and go.

CONNECT FROM ANYWHERE
With dual-band Wi-Fi and Bluetooth 4.0, including support for hundreds of networks worldwide, you'll stay entertained -- and connected -- wherever you are (select models only).

DESIGNED FOR ENTERTAINMENT
With eye-popping performance, surround-sound and a stunning 1080p HD display, Nexus 7 is great for gaming. Kick back with a huge selection of ebooks, listen to streaming radio and millions of songs, and immerse yourself in thousands of movies and TV shows on Google Play. With an ever-expanding number of tablet-optimised apps, you’ll find all the apps you love, and love the many apps you’ll find.

SOUND THAT SURROUNDS
Nexus 7 features stereo speakers and Surround Sound powered by Fraunhofer 3 (the MP3 inventors) so you get rich and immersive audio. Hear it all more clearly with finely tuned volume boost technology that makes dialog and sound crisp and easier on the ears.

POWERED BY ANDROID
Nexus 7 comes preloaded with the powerful Android Jelly Bean 4.3 operating system, so it's fast, fun and easy to make your own. Share your tablet with friends and family -- each person has a separate customisable space, including personal homescreens, wallpaper, apps, storage and more. You can also manage access to apps and content to create an experience that’s appropriate for each member of the family.

Make the most with Google apps, which comes preloaded on the Nexus 7, including Chrome, Gmail, YouTube, Hangouts and Google Now. You can browse, watch, share and stay connected wherever you go. Google apps are designed for the cloud, meaning everything is simple and works seamlessly across your phone, tablet and computer. Now you have all the stuff you need, when you need it.

ALL THE POWER AND SPEED YOU NEED
Nexus 7 is made by ASUS and packs a serious punch. With a 1.5Ghz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon S4 Pro processor and 2GB of RAM, everything runs faster. Plus, high-performance rendering ensures 3D graphics are smooth and dynamic.

ABOUT ASUS
As one of the world's leading consumer notebook brands, ASUS prides itself by making products that always "START with PEOPLE." With a persistent approach to innovation, ASUS goes beyond satisfying customer needs to surpass expectations and spark the imaginations of people everywhere. ASUS designs and manufactures a diverse range of products as part of our relentless search for incredible, including motherboards, graphics cards, displays, desktop and all-in-one PCs, notebooks, netbooks, networking devices, servers, smartphones and tablets.



LEGAL DISCLAIMER
Item has non-functioning usb port, We do not accept returns on the basis of usb non-functional issues!

BOX CONTAINS
ASUS Tablet
Power Adapter
User Documentation
Warranty Card

See more
